getStatusCode

Get the HTTP status code for this request.
Returns:

getHeader

public java.util.Vector getHeader(java.lang.String name)
Get a HTTP header. Examples include: status, Date, Server, Last-Modified, Content-Length, Content-Type, Set-Cookie.
Parameters:
name - The name of the header to look up.
Returns:
values A vector of values associated with the header, or null of the header was not found.

getHeader

public java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String name,
                                  int index)
Lookup the i-th header value for a given header.
Parameters:
name - The name of the header.
index - The value to recover, e.g., zero for the first value.
Returns:
value The index-th value of the header, or null if none was found.

getBetween

public java.lang.String getBetween(java.lang.String start_text,
                                   java.lang.String end_text)
From the body, get the text from between a start and end string.

This is a convieniece method to help you find particular text on a page.

E.g., if you page contains the text: "Reason for error: something bad happened." You can extract the reason with: String reason = request.extractBetween("Reason for error: ", ".");

Parameters:
start_text - The start text to search for,
end_text - The text that ends the item you're looking for.
Returns:
between The text between the end of the start_text and the start of the end text. Got that? Null if no match was found. If more than one match is found, only the first is returned.
See Also:
getBetweens(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

getBetweens

public java.lang.String[] getBetweens(java.lang.String start_text,
                                      java.lang.String end_text)
From the body, extract all occurances of the text between a start and end string.

Parameters:
start_text - The start text to search for,
end_text - The text that ends the item you're looking for.
Returns:
betweens Array containing the text between the end of the start_text and the start of the end text for all occurances of the start text. Null if start_text or end_text is null or if there is no body text to search. Can be a zero length array.
See Also:
for details and if you're only looking for one match.
